Describe the type of relationship between two people in the following short story.
John and Max haven’t seen each other since high school. They meet at a cafe and they end up talking for hours.

The relationship between John and Max in the short story can be described as a rekindled friendship. Although they haven't seen each other since high school, their ability to engage in a long conversation upon meeting at the cafe suggests a sense of familiarity and comfort with each other. This implies that they likely had a meaningful connection in the past, which they were able to easily resume despite the time apart. Their interaction indicates mutual interest and enjoyment in each other's company, which are key aspects of a friendly relationship.
